text.content:
S: Patient feels well this morning. desires to go home. Believes her breathing 
is much improved although still unable to lay flat on her back at night. 
 
O:
VITAL SIGNS:
            B/P:  128/69 (11/19/2011 05:05)
          Pulse:  97 (11/19/2011 05:05)
    Temperature:  99.6 F (11/19/2011 05:05)
   Respirations:  20 (11/19/2011 05:05)
         Weight:  261 lb [118.6 kg] (11/18/2011 13:22)
         Height:  64 in [162.6 cm] (07/20/2010 14:00)
            BMI:  45
           Pain: 
           SP02:  overnight 88 on RA; now 97 on 2L
 
 
PE:
Gen: well developed 55 yo female in NAD, A&Ox3
CV: Normal rate with irregular rhythm. JVP elevated just below angle of mandible 
at 90 degrees
Chest: Decreased basilar BS R>L
Abd: Obsese, soft, NT/ND. Positive BS. No HSM, massses. 
Ext: trace LE edema
 
MEDICATIONS:
Active Inpatient and Outpatient Medications (including Supplies):
 
     Inpatient Medications                                  Status
=========================================================================
1)   ACETAMINOPHEN TAB  1000MG PO Q6H PRN for pain          ACTIVE
2)   ASPIRIN TAB  325MG PO QDAY FOR HEART                   ACTIVE
3)   CALCIUM CARBONATE TAB  500MG PO Q8H                    PENDING
4)   DEXTROSE INJ,SOLN in DEXTROSE 20% IN WATER 500 ML      ACTIVE
       INFUSE OVER 45 Minutes IV BID PRN
5)   ENALAPRILAT INJ,SOLN  1.25MG/1ML IV Q6H for            ACTIVE
       hypertension
6)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) TAB  0.125MG PO QDAY      ACTIVE
 
     Outpatient Medications                                 Status
=========================================================================
1)   ASPIRIN 81MG EC TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE (S)
       DAY
2)   CALCIUM CARBONATE 1.25GM (CA 500MG) TAB TAKE 500MG     ACTIVE
       TABLET(S) BY MOUTH EVERY 8 HOURS
3)   CHLORTHALIDONE 25MG TAB TAKE ONE-HALF TABLET BY MOUTH  ACTIVE
       EVERY DAY
4)   ERGOCALCIFEROL 1000 UNIT CAP TAKE 1000 UNITS BY MOUTH  ACTIVE
       EVERY DAY
5)   GLYBURIDE 2.5MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
6)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) 0.125MG TAB TAKE ONE      ACTIVE
       TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY
7)   LISINOPRIL 20MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
8)   SIMVASTATIN 80MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY    ACTIVE
       DAY
9)   VENLAFAXINE HCL 75MG SA CAP TAKE ONE CAPSULE BY MOUTH  ACTIVE
       TWICE A DAY
 
15 Total Medications
 
ALLERGIES/ADRS:
METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE
 
A/P: 55 year old female c PMHx CAD, DM, depression, admitted with cough/SOB; cxr 
reveals pnuemonia. 
 
1. continue ABx, chest xr in am
 
2. fs glucose qac, and am labs
 
3. oob to chair
 
This patient was discussed with Dr. Aviva, attending physician, who agrees
with the medical management outlined in my note and believes it is
medically appropriate.
text.author: RESIDENT,ONE

text.content:
Agree with Resident assessment above.  In addition, will D/C IV meds and switch 
to PO.  Plan to d/c tomorrow morning if CBC and chest XRay improved.
text.author: PROVIDER,ONE
